conclusion: Objects A and B, each with a mass of m=1kg, are attached to the two ends of a massless string.
The string passes over a fixed pulley at the top of an inclined plane with an angle of θ=37°, which is fixed on a horizontal ground.
Initially, object B is pulled to the bottom of the inclined plane, while object A is at a height of h=1m above the ground.
Friction between B and the inclined plane, as well as between the string and the pulley, is negligible.
The system is released from rest and allowed to move.
The connection between object B and the string breaks at the moment object A hits the ground.
Object A is hanging vertically at a height of 1m above the ground.
Object B is positioned at the bottom of the inclined plane.

premise: Object A is at a height of 1m and will fall under gravity.
conclusion: Object A will take time t to hit the ground, calculated using the equation of motion under gravity.

premise: Object A falls 1m under gravity with g=10m/s².
conclusion: Time taken for object A to hit the ground is t = sqrt(2h/g) = sqrt(2*1/10) = 0.447s.

premise: The connection between object B and the string breaks when object A hits the ground.
conclusion: Object B starts moving up the inclined plane with initial velocity acquired during A's fall.

premise: Object B moves up the inclined plane with initial velocity v acquired during A's fall.
conclusion: Calculate v using conservation of energy: mgh = 0.5mv², v = sqrt(2gh) = sqrt(20) = 4.47m/s.

premise: Object B moves up the inclined plane with initial velocity v = 4.47m/s.
conclusion: Object B will decelerate due to gravity component along the incline.

premise: Gravity component along the incline is g*sin(37°) = 10*sin(37°).
Object B moves with initial velocity 4.47m/s and deceleration 6m/s².
conclusion: Time taken to stop is t = v/a = 4.47/6 = 0.745s.
